article_title: Warm winter creates slowest start to flu season in five years
article_text: Scientists develop a new vaccine each year based on what strains of the virus are circulating and predictions on how they may mutate, with varying degrees of success. The small amount of virus found so far in the U.S., and the higher levels overseas, look very much like what was used to build the vaccine, Bresee said. That typically means the vaccine is more effective, he said. There is still time for those who haven't get been vaccinated to do so.

article_metadata.description: The virus thrives in a dry, cold environment and winter is typically a dangerous time of year for the elderly and a costly one for health insurers.

og.description: The virus thrives in a dry, cold environment and winter is typically a dangerous time of year for the elderly and a costly one for health insurers.

article_summary:
Scientists develop a new vaccine each year based on what strains of the virus are circulating and predictions on how they may mutate, with varying degrees of success.
There is still time for those who haven't get been vaccinated to do so.
That typically means the vaccine is more effective, he said.
The small amount of virus found so far in the U.S., and the higher levels overseas, look very much like what was used to build the vaccine, Bresee said.
